Turkmenistan.Name: Turkmenistan
Turkmenistan.Motto: Türkmenistan Bitaraplygyň watanydyr (Turkmenistan is the motherland of Neutrality)
Turkmenistan.Anthem: Garaşsyz Bitarap Türkmenistanyň Döwlet Gimni (National Anthem of Independent Neutral Turkmenistan)

Government.Type: Unitary presidential republic under a totalitarian hereditary dictatorship

Turkmenistan.History: Turkmenistan has a rich history and was once an important stop on the Silk Road. It was annexed by the Russian Empire in 1881 and later became a constituent republic of the Soviet Union. It gained independence in 1991.
Turkmenistan.Human Rights: The country is widely criticized for its poor human rights record, treatment of minorities, and lack of press and religious freedoms.
Turkmenistan.Leadership: Turkmenistan has been ruled by repressive regimes, including President for Life Saparmurat Niyazov, Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedow, and his son Serdar.
Turkmenistan.Natural Resources: Turkmenistan possesses the world's fifth-largest reserves of natural gas.
Turkmenistan.Geography: Most of the country is covered by the Karakum Desert.
Turkmenistan.International Relations: Turkmenistan is an observer state in the Organisation of Turkic States, the Türksoy community, and a member of the United Nations.
